description: From Middle French morbifique, or its source, post-classical morbificus, from Latin morbus (“sickness”).

adjectives.description: morbific (comparative more morbific, superlative most morbific)

entries.meaning: That causes disease; sickening, pathogenic. [from 17th c.]
examples: He accepted that the body was a machine, mathematically understandable, but disease was the effort by nature or the soul to expel morbific matter, and physiology was the science of that struggle.

entries.meaning: Pertaining to or caused by disease; diseased. [from 17th c.]
